get.summary: Illustrate the scale as a pitch class bracelet diagram
get.description: Illustrate the scale as a pitch class bracelet diagram. The Blue bead is the fifth generator root. The Orange bead is the imperfect pitch. Green beads has previous and next fifth sibling. The red bead is the orphan pitch (it does not have previous and next fifth sibling)

get.summary: Illustrate the scale as a circle of fifth bracelet diagram
get.description: Illustrate the scale as a circle of fifth bracelet diagram. The Blue bead is the fifth generator root. The Orange bead is the imperfect pitch. Green beads has previous and next fifth sibling. The red bead is the orphan pitch (it does not have previous and next fifth sibling)

ZeitlerPitchNumber.title: Pitch number in William Zeitler's numbering system
ZeitlerPitchNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is most significant bit and BNatural is the least significant bit. So CNatural number is 2048 while BNatural number is 1

RingPitchNumber.title: Pitch number in Ian Ring's numbering system
RingPitchNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is least significant bit and BNatural is the most significant bit. So CNatural number is 1 while BNatural number is 2048

ZeitlerChordNumber.title: Chord number in William Zeitler's numbering system
ZeitlerChordNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is most significant bit and BNatural is the least significant bit. So CNatural number is 2048 while BNatural number is 1

RingChordNumber.title: Chord number in Ian Ring's numbering system
RingChordNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is least significant bit and BNatural is the most significant bit. So CNatural number is 1 while BNatural number is 2048

items.description: Pitch class number, 0 being CNatural and 11 being BNatural

rotational_symmetric.description: True when scale is rotational symmetric

reflectional_symmetric.description: True when scale is reflectional symmetric

fifth_generator_root_degree.description: The degree of the note in the scale that can be used to generate the whole scale using circle of fifth

ScaleCardinality.title: Scale cardinality
ScaleCardinality.description: Count of note in an octave of a scale

ZeitlerScaleNumber.title: Scale number in William Zeitler's numbering system
ZeitlerScaleNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is most significant bit and BNatural is the least significant bit. So CNatural number is 2048 while BNatural number is 1

RingScaleNumber.title: Scale number in Ian Ring's numbering system
RingScaleNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is least significant bit and BNatural is the most significant bit. So CNatural number is 1 while BNatural number is 2048

ScalePerfection.title: Scale perfection
ScalePerfection.description: Count of perfect notes in the scale

ScaleImperfection.title: Scale imperfection
ScaleImperfection.description: Count of imperfect notes in the scale

ZeitlerKeyNumber.title: Key number in William Zeitler's numbering system
ZeitlerKeyNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is most significant bit and BNatural is the least significant bit. So CNatural number is 2048 while BNatural number is 1

RingKeyNumber.title: Key number in Ian Ring's numbering system
RingKeyNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is least significant bit and BNatural is the most significant bit. So CNatural number is 1 while BNatural number is 2048

items.description: Pitch class number. 0 being CNatural, 11 being BNatural
Number of semitones between each notes

ZeitlerChordQualityNumber.title: Chord quality number in William Zeitler's numbering system
ZeitlerChordQualityNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is most significant bit and BNatural is the least significant bit. So CNatural number is 2048 while BNatural number is 1

RingChordQualityNumber.title: Chord quality number in Ian Ring's numbering system
RingChordQualityNumber.description: Value is determined by bitmap weight where CNatural is least significant bit and BNatural is the most significant bit. So CNatural number is 1 while BNatural number is 2048

ChordQualityCardinality.title: Chord quality cardinality
ChordQualityCardinality.description: Count of note in a given chord quality
